They also play a key role in working with private offices in other Departments to ensure cross-cutting/cross government business is handled effectively.

Job/Team Function: To identify and support the workforce practice which will most effectively deliver the Department's policy priorities by: 1.defining effective workforce practice, including on integrated working. 2. supporting the development and deployment of the school workforce. 3. supporting the development of relevant and effective workforce skills and qualifications. 4. raising performance by developing arrangements to address poor classroom practice in schools. 5.managing the Departments relationship with the Childrens Workforce Development Council

Name: Simon Parkes
Job/Team Function: Director Finance and Commercial Group. Responsible for leading the Departments Finance and Commercial functions to enable the Department to achieve its key priorities  delivering new Academies, Free Schools, reform of Arms Length Bodies; the delivery ofsignificant reductions in administrative expenditure andsupporting more effective procurement inschools. Providingsupport to the Accounting Officer and ensuringthe Department secures value for moneythrough developing the Departments management information; ensuring that the right information is available at the right time to support the Departments strategic decision making

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: This post provides analysis and evidence to all IFD, leading professional analysts from four disciplines (economists / statistician / social researchers / operational researchers). On education funding, this includes financial modelling to allocate funding to LAs for maintained schools and to calculate the budgets for individual Academies. Additionally we model affordability, develop funding methodologies (e.g. Pupil Premium, Fair Funding Formula), and monitor how this funding is budgeted and account for how it is spent. Similar roles exist for post-16 learning routes and for Capital Funding. We also provide statistical analysis to project and plan the rate of Academies expansion; report on Academies educational standards; assess demand for Free Schools, UTCs and Studio Schools; and, generate performance indicators for IFD. We articulate the economic rationale for policy reform and explain the value for money in ministerial recommendations. Finally, we provide research evidence review and synthesis, policy evaluation and produce and analyse the Departments longitudinal data on the lives of young people.
Unit: Infrastructure Funding and Longitudinal Analysis Division

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Joint Head of the Preventing Extremism Unit. Responsible for ensuring that children are not exposed to extremists or extremist views in schools or out of school hours learning. Responsible for due diligence arrangements to ensure that people with extremist views are not able to establish or take over schools.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Child Poverty Unit: Reporting jointly to the Department for Work and Pensions, Department for Education and HMT, the Unit's purpose is to oversee the government's strategy for ending child poverty and to work with partners across government and with stakeholders so that different policies make maximum impact on child poverty
Unit: Supporting Children and Young People Group

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director with responsibility for all matters relating to school workforce Terms and Conditions of employment. The main focus of the Division's work is on: 1. Pay / pensions / conditions of employment together with their associated reform programmes. 2.Giving effect to the Coalition Government's priorities for giving schools greater freedoms and flexibilities over pay and conditions. 3. Managing the contract for the administration of the Teachers' Pension Scheme and other related contracts. 5. Representing the DfE interests on cross-Government workforce initiatives

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Resourcing & Operations Division. 1. Delivering a structured programme of business process and system change across Academies, Free Schools and Education Funding. 2. Engaging Infrastructure & Funding Directorate (IFD) staff through communication, training and involvement to cultivate continuous improvement, implement new ways of working and achieve efficiencies. 3. Ensuring IFD manages its people in the most effective and efficient way and that we have the right number of skilled and motivated people to deliver our priorities.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Division leads on policy in respect of initial teaching training and school leadership. Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director Efficiency and Reform Division. To develop an operating model for Finance and Commercial Activity and work with ALB Finance and Commercial Directors to ensure that NDPBs have effective Finance and Commercial functions until closure (and beyond) and new Executive Agency set up is achieved. To work with the People and Change Group to manage the transition of people from the ALBs into the Department and to support the Head of Finance professionalism.

Job/Team Function: Responsible for policy advice and delivery of Ministerial priorities on teachers and the school and children's workforce, including training, standards, regulation, misconduct, pay, pensions and industrial relations

Name: N/D

To lay unqualified Departmental Resource Accounts before Recess and complete the Clear Line of Sight implementation across the Departmental family. Second the Division provides services such as grant payments on behalf of the DfE teams responsible for managing the relationships withmany DfE ALBs.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Head of Internal Audit leads a team of professionally trained auditors - reporting to the Accounting Officer on the effectiveness of risk management and control in the Department. This is through specific audit reports on particular areas and periodic reports on the overall levels of Departmental compliance. In addition work is also undertaken on an ad hoc basis to provide advice/support and investigation services as required. The Unit also provides Secretariat services to the Audit and Risk Assurance Committee and provides a liaison function with Heads of Internal Audit and Audit Committee Chairs across the Departments' NDPBs.This is a shared post between DfE and Home Office, with each Department meeting 50% of the costs

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The division leads on policy and delivery leading the Departments relationship with the Training and Development Agency for Schools and the National College  in respect of initial teacher training / development of Early Years Professionals / supply of head-teachers / development of new roles such as National Leaders of Education and training for Directors of Children's Services. Job/Team Function: Responsible for: 1. Job/Team Function: The Schools Commissioner is responsible for 1) Identifying and agreeing new Academies in place of underperforming schools; 2) Identifying new Academy sponsors and working with existing sponsors to identify new Academy projects; 3) Policy and systems for approving organisations to sponsor Academies and matching sponsors to projects; 4) Monitoring the performance of open Academies; 5) Challenging and supporting Academies where their performance is below the expected levels; 6) Promoting government policy to extend the opportunities for Academy status for all schools, in order to narrow the gap in school performance

The law on physical punishment of children. 3. Reforming the law on child employment and children who perform. 4. Private fostering. 5. Reforming the National Minimum Standards for Residential Family Centres. The Unit provides strategy, business planning, HR, administration and finance support to the whole of Safeguarding Group, including administering a number of grants to the voluntary and community sector.
